title: MDS Nurse
company: The Grand Pavilion for Rehab and Nursing at Rockville Center
description:
**MDS Nurse**



The Grand Pavilion is looking for a talented and hard-working MDS Assessor to join our ever-growing team.  

We are seeking qualified candidates who have experience as an RN and are committed to help our patients and facilities receive the support they need.



Responsible for completion of the Resident Assessment Instrument in accordance with federal and state regulations and company policy and procedures.  

Acts as in-house case manager by considering all aspects of the residents care and coordinating services with physicians, families, third party payers and facility staff.


**MDS Nurse** **Essential Job Functions**


* Oversees accurate and thorough completion of the Minimum Data Set (MDS), Care Area Assessments (CAAs) and Care Plans, in accordance with current federal and state regulations and guidelines that govern the process
* Acts as an in-house Case Manager demonstrating detailed knowledge of residents health status, critical thinking skills to develop an appropriate care pathway and timely communication of needed information to the resident, family, other health care professionals and third party payers
* Proactively communicates with Administrator and Director of Nursing to identify regulatory risk, effectiveness of Facility/Community Systems that allow capture of resources provided on the MDS, clinical trends that impacts resident care, and any additional information that has an affect on the clinical and operational outcomes of the Facility/Community
* Utilizes critical thinking skills and collaborates with therapy staff to select the correct reason for assessment and Assessment Reference Date (ARD). Captures the RUG score which reflects the care and services provided
* Demonstrates an understanding of MDS requirements related to varied payers including Medicare, Managed Care and Medicaid
* Ensures timely electronic submission of all Minimum Data Sets to the state data base. Reviews state validation reports and ensures that appropriate follow-up action is taken
* Facilitates the Care Management Process engaging the resident, IDT and family in timely identification and resolution of barriers to discharge resulting in optimal resident outcomes and safe transition to the next care setting
* Directly educates or provides company resources to the IDT members to ensure they are knowledgeable of the RAI process. Provides an overview of the MDS Coordinator and Assessor role to new employees that are involved with the RAI process. Teach and train new or updated RAI or company processes to interdisciplinary team (IDT) members as needed
* Analyzes QI/QM data in conjunction with the Director of Nursing Services to identify trends on a monthly basis
* Responsible for timely and accurate completion of Utilization Review and Triple Check
* Serves on, participates in, and attends various other committees of the Facility/Community (e.g., Quality Assessment and Assurance) as required, and as directed by their supervisor and Administrator


**MDS Nurse** **Qualifications****:**


* Registered Nurse with current, active license in state of practice.
* Minimum two (2) years of clinical experience in a health care setting
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience in a long term care setting
* Prior experience as an MDS coordination accepted
* Training program available for RN candidates with demonstrated assessment skills


**Salary: Up to $55 an hour (Based on Experience open to negotiations)**



An Equal Opportunity Employer



INDRN

title: Home Health Weekend Admission RN
description:
The RN would be on call from Friday at 4:30 pm until Monday at 8:00 am (eastern). The RN would be responsible to cover any as-needed visits that arise, as well as scheduled weekend visits including admission visits. Compensation will include an on-call stipend PLUS pay per visit for each visit completed. The Nurse will be responsible for assessing patient health problems and needs, developing and implementing nursing care plans, and maintaining medical records. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration is required.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**



The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:


* On call from Friday at 4:30 pm until Monday at 8:00 am (Eastern)
* Must cover any as-needed visits that arise, as well as schedule weekend visits, including admission visits
* Provide skilled nursing treatments as ordered by the client’s doctor
* Complete evaluation tasks, including vital signs and medication reviews
* Coordinate with physicians, therapists, and other individuals in the client’s care plan
* Assess and chart observations of the client’s condition at each visit
* Maintain complete and accurate documentation of nursing care
* Work collaboratively with all members of the healthcare team
* Provide education to clients and families on proper home health care procedures and strategies
* Record patients' medical information and vital signs
* Monitor, record, and report symptoms or changes in patient's conditions
* Administer local, inhalation, intravenous, or another anesthetic
* Prepare patients for and assist with examinations or treatments
* Modify patient treatment plans as indicated by patients' responses and conditions
* Order, interpret, and evaluate diagnostic tests to identify and assess patient's condition
* Monitor all aspects of patient care, including diet and physical activity
* Engage in research activities and participation in formal educational training activities related to nursing
* Perform other duties as assigned


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES)**


* Must be available on weekends from Friday 4:30 pm until Monday 8:00 am (Eastern)
* Associate degree required; Graduate of an accredited state-approved, Bachelor’s Degree from a school of nursing preferred
* Current and valid Connecticut Registered Nurse License
* Prior nursing experience, specifically in home health (preferred)
* Current CPR certification (required)
* Driver’s License
* Car Insurance
* Car Registration
* Strong interpersonal skills that build personal rapport and establish trust with the client
* Computer literate
* Strong organizational skills
* Excellent written and communication skills
* Ability to meet physical demands of the job (ex: lifting 50 pounds for transfers)
* Home health care experience
* Bilingual (Spanish) preferred


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**


* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this position successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, and handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms.
* The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
* The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.

title: DON, Director of Nursing, Subacute/LTC Units
description:
Do you look forward to caring for others by planning patient care, administering medicines, performing diagnostic tests and operating medical equipment? Do you enjoy creating a strong foundation for young nurses to build a flourishing career on by providing guidance and educational courses? If you do, apply for the **Director of Nursing (DON)** role at our medical facility. This fast-paced, caring environment gives you the perfect place to implement new community outreach programs and innovative patient care techniques all while working as a part of a dedicated team. You get the chance to make a difference and enrich the lives of countless patients and their families right when you start as the director of nursing.


### **Job Responsibilities**


* **Provide** top-of-the-line care to patients by giving them medicine, reading equipment and diagnosing diseases or injuries
* **Teach** educational nursing courses to keep those under you up to date on the newest technology and patient care procedures
* **Counsel** patients on self-care and the potential side effects drug regimens can have so they fully understand their options and how to take care of themselves

* **Develop** patient treatment plans using standard of care, scientific rationale and professional practice policies as guidelines

title: Regional Sales Exec
description:
**About Mobile Health**



Mobile Health is a market leader in occupational health and employment-related screening services across the United States. With five owned-and-operated clinics in New York City, and over 6,500 affiliated locations, Mobile Health sees millions of patients per year. Our comprehensive services include drug testing, physicals, respirator fit testing, hearing testing, vision screening, vaccines and titers, and more. We stack hands to support our B2B client partners and are on a mission to make occupational health and employment-related screening the easiest part of their job. To achieve that, we are leveraging technology to change how occupational health is delivered. As a technology-driven company, we’re at the forefront of unleashing new and better ways to keep businesses safe and their employees healthy. Mobile Health is growing, and we are looking for amazing people to join our team!

  


**Location:** Hybrid  

This position includes travel locally. Additional travel to corporate headquarters for meetings and training may be necessary. Company-related travel, outside of the standard commute, will be reimbursed.

  


**Hours of Operation**



Full-time Monday through Friday with occasional weekend hours.

  


**Salary**



$60,000-80,000 plus commission plan

  


**DO MORE. BE MORE.**

**BE A REGIONAL SALES EXECUTIVE AT MOBILE HEALTH**

  



First things first — we’re not your normal business. Mobile Health is a healthcare and technology company with big ambitions. We look at each day with the energy and spirit of a start-up and an insatiable hunger to never stop doing great things.

  



That’s why we’ve been disrupting the occupational health industry since our beginning in 1984 and continue to do so with our game-changing technology and new approaches to meeting our clients’ pre-employment and compliance testing needs.

  




We’re expanding across the United States with more than 6,500 clinics, a mobile fleet, and the ability to deliver care on-site, at our client's doorstep. We’re changing the way companies think about employee health and safety. We work hard to create a world where occupational health and employee screeningare an open door to growth. Our dedication is real. You can feel the passion and enthusiasm. We break barriers. We’re the solution the industry desperately needs. We need great thinkers, activators, strategists, and managers who want to share in our passion to get things done.

  




Do we sound like the kind of company — and culture — you’re looking for? Are you in a sales role today and want to move on to do the best work of your life? If you’re ready to join us, we can’t wait to meet you. Read on to learn more about Mobile Health and our Regional Sales Executive role.

  


**STEP UP. STEP IN. OWN IT.**



As the CEO of your market, we expect you to engage in high-profile client relationships to execute your sales strategy. You are the driving force in a large territory and will be an integral part of our National Sales Team to deliver results. We’ll give you all the autonomy you could ever ask for, underpinned by the support you need to be successful. No micro-managers here — we want you to step up, step in, and own it.

  


**WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE**



If you’re currently in a sales role — in any industry — you know that your day is all about finding opportunities where there’s an amazing marriage between what the client needs and what we have to offer. You’re advocating for your client, going to bat to find a great solution, and developing relationships with long-term value. That means your day looks like this:

  


* You’re developing a pipeline of opportunities based on a strategic territory plan and collaborating with leadership to support you.


* Reaching out and making friends, turning “no’s” into “yeses” and showing the company’s unique solutions tailored to our client’s needs.


* You’re a go-to, trusted expert. When the client says, “I’m not sure who can solve this?” you would be the first person they call.


* You’re a visible member of speaking panels, trade shows, conferences, and any other event where your community of prospects are meeting to talk.


* You love Salesforce so much you could cry. Well, maybe not, but you get the idea. You’ll be keeping Salesforce updates with all client and deal information.


* You’re preparing quotes, pricing, and assisting with RFIs or RFPs.

  


**CARE AND LOVE**



And we will take care of you. You’ll be working with colleagues who are passionate and driven to succeed. You’ll learn from the best. And we expect your best each day. We provide a generous compensation package, great benefits, a remote work environment, and everything you need to be successful. Did we mention an unlimited PTO policy? Technically, we call it our “responsible use” policy, meaning, don’t ruin it for everyone. We expect you to work hard. And we expect you to live your life.

  


**WHY DO WE NEED YOU?**



Mobile Health continues to grow. Rapidly. And the key to your success is our success. We think of our Sales Executives as the tip of the spear. Our Marketing Team will deliver you leads, and you’ll be hunting for them on your own. We can’t do this alone, which is why we need you to help us continue our growth. We’ll rely on you to create your own strategies and business plans to:

  


* Expand market share and adoption of our products and services within a specific territory.
* Be an advocate for Mobile Health and the great work we do every day.
* Build a sales pipeline that you’ll be proud of and will reward you with generous compensation.

  


**DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**



We want people who are skilled relationship developers, have an entrepreneurial spirit, and approach everything they do with passion. We’re looking for a respected professional who exhibits keen business instincts, is creative, and above all, can drive results. You could be a great fit if you have:

  


* A persuasive, energetic, independent operator mindset who can earn and retain a “seat at the table.”


* Strong planning skills to focus on an individual territory.


* Comfortable dealing with — and managing in — an extremely fluid, fast-paced environment (we don’t stop around here…. it’s a driving force of our company DNA)


* Amazing communication skills, optimism, and confidence

  


**SKILL SET vs. PRIOR EXPERIENCE**



We’re all about looking for the right people. If you have a go-getter, sales skillset, but have never worked in healthcare, that’s ok! We want you to apply! Sales Executives with a few years’ experience are great. If you believe in yourself, can show us what you’re made of, and feel inspired after reading this job post, then we want you to apply.

  


**WE BELIEVE IN DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION**



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.



We want a team of people who are driven to do great work, and we believe that great work and great ideas can come from anyone, anywhere.

title: HHA needed in Manhattan!!

TrustHouse is a premier provider of compassionate and professional home health care services. We specialize in delivering personalized in-home care to individuals who require assistance with daily living activities. Our team is committed to enhancing the quality of life for our clients by offering a wide range of services, including personal care, companionship, medication management, and specialized care for chronic conditions. At TrustHouse, we prioritize the well-being, dignity, and independence of our clients, ensuring they receive the highest standard of care in the comfort of their own homes. Join our team and make a meaningful difference in the lives of those we serve.



Are you a dedicated Home Health Aide with an active NY Home Health Aide Certificate? We want you on our team!


**Shifts Available:** 8-12 hours, both day and night shifts in Manhattan. Immediate openings!!


**Starting Pay:** $24-$25/hr with opportunities for up to 20 hours of OVERTIME!



Make a meaningful difference in the lives of those in need. Apply today to be considered for immediate work!


**Responsibilities:**


* Perform home management tasks including housekeeping, laundry, shopping, accompanying to appointments, and errands
* Prepare and serve simple modified diets according to instruction and assist with feeding
* Assist with bathing, dressing, and grooming
* Assist with medication as specified on plan of care
* Observe and report all changes to the RN Manager
* Demonstrate competence in performing necessary skills
* Complete all other duties assigned within the HHA scope of practice

**Benefits:**


* Weekly pay
* Health Insurance
* 401(k) Plan
* Sick Pay and Holiday Pay
* Client Referral Bonus: $500 + Commission
* Caregiver Referral Bonus: $500

* Paid In-Service offered weekly

**Requirements:**

**Apply now and join a team committed to excellence in patient care!**



If you are passionate about providing top-quality care and want to work in a supportive and rewarding environment, we would love to hear from you. Take the next step in your caregiving career and apply today!

title: Corporate HR Director
description:
**Position Summary:**



Oversees all Human Resources functions. The Director of Human Resources will play a pivotal role in overseeing all aspects of human resources management within our organization, ensuring compliance with labor laws, promoting a positive workplace culture, and supporting the strategic objectives of the company.


**Essential Responsibilities – Overview:**
* Lead and oversee HR projects and initiatives, ensuring timely completion and alignment with organizational goals.
* Manage and optimize the Human Resources Information System (HRIS) to streamline processes and enhance data accuracy.
* Collaborate with senior leadership to develop and execute HR strategies that support the company's long-term objectives.
* Provide leadership and guidance to the human resources team, fostering a culture of teamwork and professional development and coaches’ employees at all levels regarding programs and policies.
* Serve as a trusted advisor to management on HR-related matters, providing guidance and recommendations to support decision-making.
* Stay abreast of changes in labor laws and regulations, ensuring compliance and minimizing legal risks for the organization.
* Addresses and resolves employee relations issues and disputes.
* Performs all other duties as assigned.


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Payroll:**


* Provide strategic guidance on payroll-related matters to business office managers, executive Directors and senior management.
* Oversee payroll processes and systems to ensure accurate and timely payment of employees. Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll tax laws and regulations.
* Oversee the administration of various payroll deductions, including Statutory deductions (taxes, social security, etc.), Voluntary deductions (retirement plans, health insurance premiums, Court-ordered deductions (child support, wage garnishments).


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Benefits:**


* Evaluate and select competitive benefit packages, including health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, and other offerings.
* Conduct regular market research and benchmarking to ensure the company's benefits offerings remain competitive within the industry.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations governing employee benefits, including ERISA, COBRA, and ACA.


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Policy and Procedures:**


* Develop and maintain company-wide initiatives and programs including annual performance management, onboarding process, culture and engagement.
* Create and manage the company's employee intranet site.
* Create and update HR policies and procedures. Ensure these policies support the unique needs of Morningside Elite Management.
* Implement policies for staff education, orientation programs, and on-the-job training specific to senior care. Establish policies for employee conduct, disciplinary actions, dress code, and confidentiality.
* Develop a progressive discipline policy to address workplace violations consistently and fairly.


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Workers Compensation:**


* Provide guidance and training to department managers and employees on workers' compensation procedures, injury reporting, and safety protocols.
* Analyze workers' compensation data to identify trends, patterns of injury, and potential areas for improvement in workplace safety.
* Manage relationships with workers' compensation insurance providers, third-party administrators, and legal counsel when necessary.
* Ensure compliance with related laws such as ADA, FMLA, and relevant state regulations.
* Prepare and present reports to senior management on workers' compensation program performance, costs, and recommendations for improvements.


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Training:**


* Develop comprehensive training materials and programs covering HRIS, performance management, labor laws and regulations. and payroll topics.
* Provide ongoing support and mentoring to ensure community directors can effectively manage their HR responsibilities.
* Conduct regular training sessions and workshops to keep directors updated on new technologies and best practices.


**Essential Responsibilities -** **Employee relations:**


* Handle and resolve employee conflicts, disputes, and grievances in a fair and consistent manner. Assist managers and supervisors in understanding and implementing company policies related to performance, discipline, and other HR matters.
* Advise on best practices for handling employee relations issues. Align employee relations strategies with overall business objectives. Develop and pursue new goals for improving employee relations within the organization


**Qualifications/Skills/Educational Requirements:**
* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field required; Master's degree preferred.
* SHRM-CP certification required. SHRM-SCP certification preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive experience in human resources management, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Experience with ADP HRIS and HCM solutions.
* Ability to travel to multiple locations as needed
* Strong understanding of HR best practices, employment law, and regulatory compliance.
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Proven leadership experience, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team towards achieving common goals.


Morningside Elite Management provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Manicurist
description:
**Do you have a passion for working with Seniors?**

**We have the job for you!!**


We are looking for a highly motivated, compassionate manicurist for a Senior Community


In this role, you must feel comfortable styling both men and women's nails and making them feel relaxed and pampered throughout their session.


Should be available to work 1-2 days per week in multiple Senior Communities and be willing to travel in the surrounding area.

  

Clean, trim, and paint nails in a nail salon.


Use emery boards, clippers, and scissors to file, trim, and shape nails into requested shape.


Perform initial consultation to ascertain client's wants and needs.


Determine if infection or breakdown of skin exists.


Soak nails in soap or solution.


Wipe off old polish.


Apply acrylic or gel nails.


Apply softening gel to cuticles.


Push back cuticles with stick and trim if needed.


Apply fake nails, colorful designs, or French manicures.


Shapes nails carefully and trim ragged edges.


Apply top, bottom, and finishing coats.


Dry nails to clients' satisfaction.


Ensure each nail is dry and problems are fixed before client leaves salon.


Soak all instruments and disinfect properly.


Pull off acrylic and help repair damaged nails.


Buff and polish nails.


Sanitize pedicure tubs and manicure station.

**"The magicians who transform fingertips into masterpieces"**

 **Must have a valid New Jersey Cosmetology License**


Please send your resume to Beth at **maxhandw@gmail.com**

title: COTA
description:
**Company Overview:**



Join our team dedicated to providing exceptional pediatric therapy services and supporting children in reaching their full potential. As a Pediatric Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant (COTA) within our facility-based setting, you will play a pivotal role in assisting licensed therapists in implementing individualized treatment plans and helping children achieve their therapy goals.


**Position Overview:** We are seeking a compassionate and enthusiastic Pediatric Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant (COTA) to join our dynamic therapy team. The successful candidate will have a passion for working with children and families, assisting in the delivery of evidence-based occupational therapy services to promote children's participation in meaningful activities and enhance their overall development and independence. The Pediatric COTA will collaborate closely with occupational therapists and other healthcare professionals to create a supportive and nurturing environment for pediatric patients.


**Responsibilities:**


* Provide hands-on therapeutic interventions and activities to enhance children's fine motor skills, visual-motor integration, sensory processing, and self-regulation.
* Engage children in therapeutic play activities and games to promote social interaction, communication, and cognitive development.
* Utilize specialized equipment and assistive devices to facilitate children's independence and participation in daily activities, school tasks, and recreational pursuits.
* Collaborate with families, caregivers, and educational teams to integrate therapy goals into children's daily routines and support carryover of skills at home and in community settings.
* Maintain accurate documentation of therapy sessions, progress notes, and treatment outcomes in compliance with regulatory and professional standards.
* Communicate effectively with parents, caregivers, and interdisciplinary team members to provide updates on children's progress and coordinate care.
  


**Qualifications:**


* Associate's degree from an accredited Occupational Therapy Assistant program.
* Current certification as a Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant (COTA) issued by the National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy (NBCOT).
* State licensure or eligibility for licensure as a COTA in the state of practice.


**Benefits:**


* $65/Hr


*Equal Opportunity Employer: We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds.*

title: looking for reliable and trustworthy chhas!!!
description:
**About Us:** Maya Home Care is a boutique PCA/Companion agency dedicated to providing exceptional home care services throughout New Jersey. Our unique company culture prioritizes compassion, excellence, and personalized care, setting us apart from any other agency. We are looking to expand our team with dedicated HHA certified caregivers who are passionate about making a difference in the lives of our clients.



Job Description: We are seeking HHA certified caregivers to join our growing team at Maya Home Care. As a caregiver, you will provide high-quality personal care and companionship to our clients, ensuring their comfort, safety, and well-being in their home. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a supportive and innovative environment where your contributions are valued. We give you patients around your area!


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist clients with daily living activities, including bathing, dressing, grooming, and meal preparation.


* Provide companionship and engage clients in meaningful activities.


* Perform light housekeeping tasks to maintain a clean and safe environment.


* Monitor and report any changes in clients' health status to the care coordinator.


* Follow individualized care plans and provide care with compassion and respect.


* Ensure clients' comfort and safety at all times.


* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of care provided.


**Qualifications:**


* HHA certification in the state of New Jersey.


* Previous experience in home care or a related field is preferred.


* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


* Compassionate, reliable, and dedicated to providing excellent care.


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation are preferred.


**What We Offer:**


* Competitive compensation.


* Aggressive Bonus structure


* A supportive and positive work environment.


* Opportunities for professional growth and development.


* Flexible scheduling to accommodate your needs.


* Comprehensive training and ongoing support.


* A company culture that values and appreciates its employees.


**How to Apply:**



If you are a compassionate and dedicated caregiver looking to join a unique and supportive home care agency, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this position.



Maya Home Care is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

  



Apply today and become a valued member of the Maya Home Care family!


**Requirements**  

**Pass background check**  

**High school diploma/GED**

  


**Must be CHHA certified in the state of NJ**

title: Director of Rehabilitation ( DOR)
description:
Are you a dynamic leader with a passion for patient care and team management? Spring Creek Healthcare Center is looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Facility Rehab Director (DOR) to lead our rehabilitation department. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a vibrant and supportive environment, we want to hear from you!
  
  

**Overview:**  

As the Director of Rehabilitation (DOR), you will oversee our rehab department, ensuring top-notch patient care that meets functional outcomes, aligns with fiscal policies, and complies with federal and state regulations. Your role will be pivotal in optimizing patient care, enhancing employee relations, and managing resources effectively to achieve financial objectives. We're seeking a professional who fosters positive interactions with patients, families, staff, and external partners.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Efficiently manage patient scheduling and delegate responsibilities to staff, ensuring optimal service delivery.
  
  

Supervise, train, educate and evaluate the rehabilitation team to uphold performance standards and deliver quality patient care.
  
  

Participate in the hiring process, maintaining a skilled, clinically competent and dedicated team.
  
  

Implement compliance and risk management policies; ensure point-of-service documentation and accurate billing.
  
  

Communicate departmental goals, achievements, and challenges effectively with administration and interdisciplinary team( IDT)
  
  

Manage department finances, including budget adherence and revenue optimization.
  
  

Ensure accurate and timely MDS reporting, adhering to all regulatory requirements.
  
  

Uphold infection control standards and facility safety protocols.
  
  

Demonstrate excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Must hold a current PT/PTA, OT/COTA, or SLP license with a strong preference for experience in long-term care/skilled nursing facilities (LTPAC/SNF).
  
  

New graduates with SNF exposure or licensed assistants with prior management experience will also be considered.
  
  

Proficiency in EMR/EHR systems, with a willingness to learn new software and clinical programs.
  
  

**Desirable Skills:**  

Knowledge of PDPM, Quality Measures, and Quality Reporting Program.
  
  

Proven leadership and team management abilities.
  
  

Experience in program development and quality assurance.
  
  

Strong financial and operational management skills.
  
  

Effective communication and relationship-building capabilities.
  
  

A commitment to continuous improvement and patient care innovation.
  
  

Join a supportive and collaborative work environment.
  
  

Enjoy opportunities for professional growth and development.
  
  

Be part of a team that values quality patient care and innovative practices.
  
  

Are you ready to lead our rehab department to new heights? Apply today and be part of a team that makes a real difference in the lives of our patients!
  
  

Apply Now!

description:
**Join** **the Vanguard of Patient-Centered Care with Vitability Health of New Jersey**


**Abo****ut Us:**



Vitability Health of New Jersey is redefining patient care by leading the transition from rehabilitation facilities to personalized home-based recovery. Our mission is to smooth the journey back to everyday life with innovative and compassionate care solutions. At the heart of our service is the belief that every patient deserves a recovery path that is not just medically sound but also emotionally supportive. We are pioneers in integrating clinical excellence with heartfelt patient advocacy, ensuring every transition is seamless.


**Your Role with Us:**  

Vitability Health of New Jersey invites you to bring your clinical prowess and care management expertise to a role that goes beyond traditional nursing. As our Healthcare Liaison, you'll be the linchpin in crafting smooth transitions for patients from rehab to home, working closely with a multidisciplinary team to tailor post-discharge plans. But that's not all. We're looking for a dynamic individual who can also wear the hat of a business developer - someone who can nurture and grow our partnerships with healthcare facilities through strategic relationship-building and effective communication.


**Why You're Perfect for This Role:**


* You have a **Valid LPN or RN license in New Jersey** and **3+ years of experience** in a nursing facility or similar healthcare environment.
* Your background in **care management** shines, especially in coordinating patient care post-discharge.
* **Clinical skills?** Top-notch. You assess, plan, and implement with precision and empathy.
* **Communication and relationship-building** are where you excel, fostering trust and cooperation with ease.
* You're **knowledgeable about healthcare regulations** and dedicated to the highest standards of patient care.
* **Business development** isn't just a buzzword for you; it's a skill you're eager to apply in fostering growth and enhancing service delivery within the healthcare sector.


**What You'll Do:**


* Conduct comprehensive patient assessments, working with healthcare teams to ensure every patient has a custom post-discharge plan.
* Be the essential communication link that brings together Vitability Health New jersey and our healthcare facility partners, ensuring clarity and coordination in care plans.
* Identify and coordinate the arrangement of patient support services, using your care management expertise to address post-discharge needs.
* Employ your flair for business development to build and deepen professional relationships with healthcare facility partners, contributing to our mission of expanding patient-centered care solutions.


**Why Join Vitability Health?**


* **Impact:** Your work directly influences patients' recovery and quality of life.
* **Growth:** With us, you're not just joining a team; you're joining a movement that values your professional development.
* **Innovation:** Be part of an organization that's at the forefront of transforming healthcare delivery.

title: Unit Clerk
description:
**Facility:** Alliance Care Rehabilitation and Nursing Center


**Position:** Unit Clerk


**Shift:** 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM


**Salary:** $18 / hr


**About Us:**



Alliance Care Rehabilitation and Nursing Center is committed to providing the highest quality of care in a compassionate and supportive environment. We are seeking a dedicated and organized Unit Clerk to join our team and support our nursing staff in delivering exceptional care to our residents.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Deliver new admission charts to the unit and initiate forms in preparation for admission.
* Fax physicians’ orders daily, first thing in the morning, from the previous shifts.
* Deliver faxed printouts to the appropriate departments.
* Complete the daily transfer of vital signs and weights from the daily assignment sheet to the resident’s chart.
* Check and restock the supply drawer at the nurses’ station as needed.
* Maintain an orderly and neat nurses’ station.
* Screen all incoming phone calls for nursing and forward messages appropriately.
* Schedule appointments with physicians for residents and relay information to nursing.
* Initiate phone calls to physicians, family members, or personnel as needed.
* Type documents as directed by Nursing Administration.
* Schedule professional agency personnel as directed and supervised by the Director of Nursing Services (DNS) and serve as the contact person for the agency.
* Notify the Food Service Department of any dietary changes.
* Maintain a current bathing schedule on the bath record for nurse aides.
* Greet visitors, guests, residents, etc., and provide information/directions in accordance with company policies and procedures.
* Ensure residents and families receive the highest quality of service in a caring and compassionate atmosphere that recognizes their needs and rights.
* Order medical supplies under the direction of the DNS.
* Fill medical supply requests in the planned absence of the Central Supply Clerk.


**Requirements:**


* Must be knowledgeable of computer systems, system applications, and other office equipment.
* Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action.
* Must be willing to seek out new methods and principles and be willing to incorporate them into existing nursing practices.


**Why Join Us?**



At Alliance Care, we value our employees and offer a supportive and collaborative work environment. This is an excellent opportunity to join a team dedicated to providing exceptional care to our residents. If you are organized, compassionate, and committed to making a difference, we would love to hear from you!

title: Graphic Designer
description:
*This is an on-site position at our office in Toms River, NJ.*


**Job Overview:**



We are seeking a talented and experienced Graphic Designer Social to join our team. As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies to enhance our brand presence of Skilled Nursing Facilities and engage with our target audience. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on our company's online presence and drive growth through effective social media marketing.


**Responsibilities:**


* Develop and execute social media strategies to increase brand awareness and drive engagement


* Create and curate engaging content for various social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Tiktok


* Monitor social media trends, stigmatize best practices, and identify opportunities for growth


* Manage all social media channels, including scheduling posts, responding to comments and messages, and monitoring analytics


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop integrated marketing campaigns that align with business objectives


* Conduct research on industry trends and competitor activities to inform social media strategies


* Utilize social listening tools to monitor brand mentions and sentiment


* Collaborate with the team to create compelling video content for social media platforms


* Assist with video editing, proofreading, and graphic design tasks as needed


* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in social media marketing, advertising, and public relations


**Qualifications:**


* Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role


* Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, and analytics tools


* Proficient in Adobe Illustrator or other graphic design software


* Excellent written and verbal communication skills


* Ability to think creatively and generate innovative ideas for content creation


* Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment


* Knowledge of advertising principles and experience running paid social media campaigns is a plus



Join our team as a Social Media Manager and help us elevate our brand presence through strategic social media marketing. Apply today to be part of our dynamic and innovative team!

title: NURSE PER DIEM 7-3/3-11/11-7
description:
**GENERAL SUMMARY:** The Licensed nurse helps to fulfill the care requirements of our residents. Under the direction of the nurse manager, the nurse will work within their entire scope of practice. He/she will be fully accountable for ensuring that competent care and safety are consistently delivered to all residents. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: • Provides nursing care within their scope of practice and in accordance with standards of care established by the facility.
  
  

* Assists with the development and revision of nursing care plans. Manages/directs the plan of care by directly administering care or by directing and supervising nursing duties delegated to nursing assistants. • Checks and records vital signs on a regular basis following established policy or at own discretion if the need exists. • Assists with residents’ comfort.
* Maintains accurate and complete records of nursing care provided. • Reports significant observations to the nurse in charge/ designee and physicians. • Reports pertinent changes in condition to the physician and the resident/health care decision maker. • Participates in purposeful daily rounds.
* Prepares and administers medications after appropriate orientation and instruction. • Maintains accurate medication records and observes residents for signs and symptoms of adverse drug reactions. • Administers special treatments, procedures, dressing changes, irrigations and other procedures requiring special techniques based on her/his nursing education and scope of practice. • Collects specimens.
* Accompanies physician on rounds when necessary; reviews physician’s orders, medications, and records to ensure prompt and accurate execution. • Attends staff education, training and other required meetings. • Maintains a clean, safe, and organized work space. • Monitors consistent application of Restorative Nursing Goals and Approaches and refers any necessary changes to the Charge Nurse for evaluation.
* Answers resident call lights promptly. • May come in contact with blood and other infectious materials, follows Universal Precautions Directs and provides assistance, observes, and monitors the activities of Nursing Assistants. • Contributes to the evaluation of CNA performance as requested. • Assure that the HIPAA and Assignment of Benefits/Medical Treatment Consent forms have been signed upon resident’s admission and placed in the Admission Director’s mailbox for processing the next day.
* Other related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned, within the scope of her/his education and under direct supervision of a Registered Nurse. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED: • Empathy and compassion • Effective verbal and written communication • Ability to read, write, and speak English • Astute observation skills • Ability to follow set rules and protocols • Time management and organizational skills • Sense of responsibility • Desire to work with others • Understand and carry out exactly, detailed oral and written instructions • Ability to keep records and make reports • Ability to secure cooperation with residents • Possess a working knowledge of nursing techniques and their relation to medical and surgical practices EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: • Graduate of an accredited School of Nursing • Must be 18 years of age or older LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION REQUIRED: • Current Basic Life Support (CPR) certification • Current Licensed Nurse in NJ

title: Care coordinator
description:
**This is not a remote postition**


**Job Title:** Care Coordinator, MA (Telemedicine Programs Specialist)

  


**Location:** Morristown, NJ

  


**Type:** Full-time


**Overview**



The Care Coordinator is a critical role designed to facilitate and enhance telemedicine services, including Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Chronic Care Management (CCM), for patients residing in Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNF). This position serves as the pivotal link between the patients in the SNF and the remote clinical team of a third-party provider, focusing exclusively on managing and coordinating telemedicine care programs. The Care Coordinator does not perform duties within the SNF itself but rather works on behalf of a third-party company to ensure effective and successful delivery of care through telemedicine services.

  


**Responsibilities**



Act as the primary liaison between SNF patients and the remote clinical team, coordinating telemedicine services such as RPM and CCM.



Facilitate the creation and implementation of patient-centered care plans by working closely with remote healthcare providers, specifically tailored to telemedicine frameworks.



Ensure continuous monitoring and assessment of patient conditions, coordinating the flow of vital data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Educate and support both patients and SNF staff on the effective use of telemedicine programs, promoting optimal management of chronic conditions and healthcare outcomes.



Advocate for the patient’s needs, ensuring they receive comprehensive and effective care through the telemedicine programs.



Bridge communication and operational gaps between SNF staff and the remote clinical team to ensure seamless delivery of telemedicine services.



Manage and maintain patient records, ensuring accurate and timely communication of health data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Monitor and evaluate patient progress within telemedicine programs, working collaboratively with all parties to adjust care plans and interventions for better health outcomes.


**Qualifications**



Certification as a Medical Assistant or in a related healthcare field.



Experience in telemedicine, RPM, or CCM programs, with a strong understanding of care coordination within these settings.



Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and coordinate between patients, healthcare providers, and facility staff.



Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the capacity to manage complex care programs and detailed patient data.



Proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) and telemedicine platforms, with a high level of digital literacy.



Knowledgeable in medical terminology, chronic condition management, and the specific requirements of telemedicine care delivery.



Independent worker with team collaboration skills, committed to enhancing patient care and outcomes through effective telemedicine coordination.


**Ideal Candidate**



The ideal candidate is a dynamic and empathetic professional, skilled in navigating the nuances of telemedicine and adept at coordinating care between remote clinical teams and patients in SNFs. This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging technology to improve healthcare delivery and patient outcomes in a telemedicine setting.

  


**To Apply**: Please submit your resume and a cover letter that highlights your experience with telemedicine programs, specifically RPM and CCM, and your proficiency in care coordination within these frameworks.

  



[Company Name] is committed to diversity and inclusion and invites applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of their background

title: R.N
description:
**OVERVIEW:**  

The Regional Nurse will be responsible for the provision of expert advice and oversight to facility management personnel and line staff to ensure that systems are maintained to effectively and efficiently operate the facility in a manner to safely meet residents' needs in compliance with federal, state and local requirements.
  
  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

Evaluate regulatory compliance and determine clinical education needs for our clients as it relates to pharmacy services
  
Conduct quality assurance audits to aid clients with preparation for successful, compliant state surveys
  
Identify and provide recommendations regarding deficiencies and opportunities around drug inventories, storage, and distribution
  
Evaluate facility compliance to clinical policy, procedure, and care
  
Visit facilities weekly for intervention, audit and training
  
Provide Quality Reviews and other nursing consultant services
  
Deliver ongoing clinical training to facility staff
  
Manage resolution of client issues and requests
  
Assist with activities associated in onboarding new facilities such as collection of resident information and medical records; scheduling, attending, and some facilitation of facility staff training; informing pharmacy of facility needs; serving as single point of contact for facility throughout onboarding process
  
Operate with strong business acumen and industry knowledge, remaining conscious of industry trends
  
Assist in the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) process
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE:**  

Minimum 3 years of recent nursing experience in a Long-Term Care setting (SNF) or Long-Term Care Surveyor experience
  
Previous Director of Nursing and/or Nurse Consulting experience is required.
  
Previous multi-facility experience required
  
A current, active license to practice as a Registered Nurse (RN) in State of practice
  
Recent clinical experience, education, or specialty skills specific to geriatrics
  
Ongoing pursuit of Continuing Education Credits in clinical subjects, management, personal growth and development
  
Demonstrate working knowledge of infection control principles and practices
  
Knowledgeable of nursing and medical practices and procedures, as well as laws, regulations and guidelines that pertain to long-term care
  
Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to work with an interdisciplinary care team
  
Ability to plan, organize, develop, implement, and interpret the programs, goals, objectives, and policies and procedures that are necessary for providing quality care
  
Capable of researching new methods and principles to incorporate them into existing nursing practices
  
Must maintain current CPR/AED certification
  
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite with a focus on Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, and Web applications
  
  

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

This position has no supervisory responsibilities
  
  

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

This job operates in a health care setting. This role requires regular walking to various locations around the care center.
  
Incumbent may be exposed to virus, disease and infection from patients and specimens in working environment.
  
Incumbent may be required to work extended periods of time at a video display terminal.
  
Incumbent may experience traumatic situations, including psychiatric, and deceased patients.
  
Works beyond normal working hours and on weekends and holidays when necessary
  
Must be able to stay or return to facility during emergency conditions
  
  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
  
  

:
  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
  
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
  
This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling and climbing all day.
  
The employee must frequently lift or move objects and patients weighing over 50 pounds.
  
  

**TRAVEL:**  

Ability to travel throughout region up to 80%

title: Registered Dietitian (Temporary)
description:
**Registered Dietitian (Temp)**



Cortlandt Manor is searching for a temporary Registered Dietitian to join their team.


**Registered Dietitian (Interim)****QUALIFICATIONS:**



NYS Registered Dietician



Three to five years experience in a long-term care setting.



Knowledge of MDS 3.0 documentation.



Knowledge of Point Click care or EMR systems


**Registered Dietitian (Interim)****GENERAL OBJECTIVES:**



To engage in the direct nutritional assessment, interview, planning, goal setting and documentation of residents’ nutritional care as prescribed by the physician and in accordance with recommended dietary allowance, practice and state code.


**Registered Dietitian (Interim)****SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:**



1. Assess, plans, coordinates and documents resident’s nutritional care. Instructs residents, families, and staff concerning essentials of nutrition for residents on therapeutic diets as prescribed by the physician.



2. Maintains records on resident’s diets and advises physicians, nursing and dietary staff of all information pertinent to their areas of responsibility. Charts progress notes on resident’s medical record.



3. Oversees the accuracy of compliance to the diet order as prescribed by the physician. Calculates tube feedings, diets, and intakes where appropriate and communicates with production personnel concerning specific requirements.



4. Works closely with the department head, food service supervisors, and other disciplines to maintain high standards of quality, efficiency and economy in managing details of the job.



5. Communicates to the department head concerning status of work load, questions, problems and experiences related to the job.



6. Attends and participates in in-service programs, continuing education, department meetings and yearly mandated facility in-service programs.



7. Demonstrates knowledge, respect and sensitivity of resident’s rights as identified within the Resident Bill of Rights and facility policy and mission statement. Assures confidentiality of all resident information.



8. Participates and is committed to Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement endeavors within the organization


**Time Frame: June - September**


**Benefits**



We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including paid holidays, vacation, personal time, sick time, 401k with company match and a pleasant working environment.


**Salary: Up to $45.00 an hour (Salaried Position) - Based on Experience.**



An Equal Opportunity Employer

Right at Home Nassau North Shore, In-Home Care & Assistance is seeking to hire certified Home Health Aides (HHA) and Personal Care Aides (PCA) to join a dynamic care team providing clinical expertise in-home. * Ambulation
* Bathing
* Personal hygiene
* Continence / toileting
* Dressing / shaving

* Transferring

Right at Home’s mission is simple ... to improve the quality of life for those we serve. Our care teams are passionate about serving our clients and are committed to providing the personal care and attention of a friend, whenever and wherever it is needed.

All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Right at Home Franchising Corporate.*

title: Behavior Technician ABA
description:
**Ready to Start Your Adventure?** **Join the Yellow Bus ABA Team: Become a Behavior Technician!**



Ready to launch your therapy career? Yellow Bus ABA seeks passionate individuals, including entry-level candidates, to join our exceptional Behavior Technician team. We offer comprehensive training, supporting our commitment to quality care for children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).


**Job Title: ABA Therapist** (Monday-Friday 8:45am-6:00pm)


**About the Role:**



As a Behavior Technician, empower children with ASD and their families to achieve milestones. Work directly with children, implementing behavior reduction protocols and teaching vital skills. This part-time role allows you to make a real difference while being part of our collaborative team. **We offer room for professional growth and advancement.**


**Responsibilities:**


* Empower children and families to maximize growth.


* Monitor progress and provide ABA services.


* Collaborate with BCBA's/LBA's and peers.


* Implement programs with compassion and quality.


**Ideal Candidate:**


* Passionate about helping children with ASD.


* Skilled at building rapport with individuals on the spectrum.


* Committed to flexible part-time schedules.


* High school diploma or equivalent required.


**Why Choose Yellow Bus ABA:**


* Competitive hourly rate.


* Opportunity to earn RBT certification and advance your career.


* Opportunities for career progression within a thriving organization.


* Be part of a collaborative team focused on well-being.


**Ready to Start Your Adventure?**



Submit your resume today! Join us at Yellow Bus ABA and be part of an organization that values growth and contribution. We promote from within and offer growth opportunities for BT candidates.

  


*Yellow Bus ABA is committed to updating applicants on their status within 24/48 hours. We provide equal employment opportunities, fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Join us in making a difference today!*

  


**Hourly rate:** $22.00 to $29.00
company_description: Yellow Bus ABA's mission is to maximize the potential of individuals with ASD so they can experience success and lead productive lives.

title: High School Limudei Qodesh Teacher
description:
**High School Limudei Qodesh Teacher**

Abraham Joshua Heschel School of Manhattan is seeking a full-time teacher for 2024-2025 to join the high school’s Limudei Qodesh department. The high school Limudei Qodesh department teaches *Tanakh*, Talmud and other genres of Rabbinic literature, and Jewish Philosophy. Members of the Limudei Qodesh department also facilitate a daily *Shacharit* minyan.  



Applicants should have a passion for teaching texts and a proven track record of outstanding differentiated instruction to students of different abilities and learning styles. A Bachelor’s degree is required; professional training in education and/or a graduate degree preferred.  



Candidates must be proficient in both biblical and rabbinic texts, and have a love of teaching and learning these texts in their original languages. Applicants are expected to be passionate about fostering connections between a diverse student body and our sacred texts. Candidates should enjoy working collaboratively with colleagues to develop and implement curricula and must be passionate about their personal and professional growth.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School, located in New York City, is an independent Jewish school, N-12, unaffiliated with any single movement or synagogue. The school's approach to education is governed by profound respect for children. We nurture children’s curiosity, cultivate their imagination, encourage creative expression, value their initiative and engender critical thinking skills. The Heschel School is dedicated to inspiring its graduates to become responsible adults and active, compassionate citizens of the Jewish world and world communities.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School is a dual-curriculum Jewish community school with families from a range of backgrounds, practices, and beliefs. We are pluralistic and deeply value openness to a diversity of opinions. Our Limudei Qodesh curriculum is text-based and values-oriented. We balance formal and creative approaches and integrate the teaching of text skills with themes of individual and communal identity.  



Qualified applicants should upload a cover letter and resume. To be considered, applicants must apply using the follwing link:

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=5db03d9d-83a7-470f-a3eb-1942264884b7&ccId=19000101\\_000001&jobId=506967&source=CC2&lang=en\\_US  



In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  



The full-time equivalent salary range is $55,000 - $95,000, depending on years of experience.

title: Hiring SCHOOL Registered Nurse in Essex, Union and Bergen Counties
description:
We are seeking a Seasonal Registered Nurse (RN)to work in the Essex, Union and Bergen counties until June 2024.



The School Registered Nurse (RN) will assist pupils and staff in attaining and/or maintaining optimum health, promote positive health habits and attitudes, evaluate the physical conditions of students and refer to appropriate resources. The School RN must be certified as such in the State of New Jersey and comply with all Federal and State licensing regulations.


**REPORTING RELATIONSHIP**



The School Registered Nurse is part of the school’s operations team and will report to the Campus Operations Manager.


**SCHEDULE**



Monday to Friday 07:30 am- 04:00 pm


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Access the physical well-being of the pupil in terms of developmental and present health status;


* Develop policies, procedures, and work standards for school health program


* Monitors compliance of school health program with federal, state, and local laws and agencies.


* Screens and conducts health appraisals for staff and students and maintains records


* Prepares health reports for supervisor, board of education and health department


* Maintains security of school health supplies


* Corresponds with parents on health needs of children


* Manages student health records; Records immunizations, health findings, and other relevant health data


* Provides professional development for staff as requested


* Participates in child study team process as needed


* Maintains and requests orders for equipment/supplies for nurse’s office and first aid station


* Administers medication to students as prescribed by a physician.


* Must be able to catheretize


* Communicate with the School Doctor as necessary and coordinate physicals.


* Must be present at the school as agreed upon with the Executive Director.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Considerable knowledge of medical disorders and treatment


* Considerable knowledge of child growth and development


* Working knowledge of public health programs and procedures for treatment in coordination with other health and social service agencies


* Experience in an acute care setting is preferred.


* The school nurse must possess a registered nurse (RN) license and BSN degree. In addition s/he must possess an NJ Department of Education School Nurse Standard


* Certificate or be eligible to obtain certification.


**COMPENSATION**


* Competative salaries being offered. Salary will be evaluated based on experience, skills and qualifications. To be discussed upon interview.


**ABOUT THE SCHOOL**



High-performing, innovative charter public school serving students from Pre-K to 12th grade on campuses across the city. Our mission is to prepare students for success in college and beyond.



Our model is based on the following guiding principles that guide our work daily –


* Creating a community that is built upon genuine and meaningful relationships. *The school staff rate our commitment to students as the #1 reason they teach/work at our schools.*



-Being surgical in our approach to differentiation of instruction and support for all students and team members. *Our students receive daily tutoring embedded into their school schedule - facilitated by our AmeriCorps team members. Staff members receive individualized coaching and support in their roles.*

-Setting and exceeding high expectations for academic growth and character development for all students, in preparation for success in college and beyond. *Currently, the historical college matriculation rate for the school is 79% - nearly twice the national average for economically underrepresented students.*


**-**


**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**  

**DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, & ACCESSIBILITY**  

The school is committed to building a talented team that reflects the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our students. Furthermore, we believe that racial justice and equity is critical to our mission of preparing students for success in college and beyond. We strive to be an organization that is diverse, equitable, inclusive, and elevates our student voices in preparing them for life and college.

  

**VACCINATION POLICY & COMMITMENT TO SAFETY**  

This School is committed to ensuring healthy and safe working and learning environments, and maintaining our educational commitment to students and families - with minimal disruption to instruction. With this in mind, as of October 2021, School requires vaccination against COVID-19 for all employees. Candidates who would like to apply for a reasonable accommodation from this policy based on a qualifying disability or sincerely held religious belief should reach out to HR@greatoakslegacy.org for more information.

  

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**  

School provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws

title: Montessori Teacher
description:
Netivot, a Montessori school in East Brunswick, NJ, seeks Montessori trained teachers for the Primary (3-5 year olds) and Upper Elementary levels (4th-6th grade) for the 2024-25 school year.
  
  

Candidates must exhibit strong communication skills, have a collaborative, team player mindset, and an intrinsic respect for children. Must have previous experience working in Montessori environments.
  
  

Responsibilities include teaching all curricular areas as part of a team with a co-teacher; presenting all lessons using approved Montessori techniques; recording and reporting on the progress of all students; managing a classroom of 15-20 students using positive discipline; meeting with other team members on a regular basis and maintaining strong team communication; communicating with parents and with supervisors as necessary. Candidates should hold or be in the process of completing teacher certification from a MACTE accredited training program.
  
  

**About the employer:**  

Netivot is widely recognized for bringing authentic Montessori education to the Jewish community. We welcome general studies teachers of all denominations to work alongside our Jewish studies teachers to provide a well rounded educational experience. Our school community includes children from infancy through 8th grade in an empowering, child-centered environment. Our methods are designed to foster independence, mastery of life skills, academic success, and a positive self concept. We welcome you to explore becoming a part of our team!
  
  

Interested applicants should direct their resumes and cover letters to office@mynetivot.com

title: Pediatric Nursing Unit Manager
description:
The Unit Manager (RN) is responsible for managing the individualized Patient care by promoting and restoring patients' health through the nursing process; collaborating with Physicians and multidisciplinary team members; providing physical and psychological support to Patients, Friends, and Families; and supervising assigned team members.



The Unit Manager, RN is responsible to the Clinical Manager for the assigned Department.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Deliver patient care through the facility Nurse activities.
* Administer medicines and intravenous fluids to patients as ordered by Physicians.
* Change wound dressings and care for other treatment options.
* Read and interpret patient information, making treatment decisions when appropriate
* Consult with supervisors and Doctors to decide on the best treatment plan for patients
* Monitor blood pressures, temperatures and vital signs at regular intervals.
* Operate oxygen apparatus, Spiro meters and other diagnosis equipment.
* Observe and report all symptoms and reactions of patients to treatment interventions.
* Assist and support Physician or Doctor in patient care deliveries.
* Direct and supervise Nurses, Nurse Assistants and Nurse Aides.
* Follow established Nursing guidelines and regulations in patient care delivery issues.


Requirements:


* Education: BS in Nursing.
* An Associate's degree in Nursing with applicable work experience may be considered in lieu of a BS.
* NYS license in Nursing with current registration is preferred.


Experience:


* Previous Long term Experience is preferable.
* Good investigative skills.
* Ability to write, educate and work independently.


Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:


* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


Schedule:


* 8 hour shift, 3:30pm-11pm
* Monday to Friday and every other weekend


Work Location:



One location


**Compensation:**



Competitive compensation ranging from $60 - $71 per hour.

  



If you are a qualified and caring Peds Unit Manager looking for an enriching opportunity to contribute to the well-being of pediatric patients, we encourage you to apply. Join our team at Ditmas Children’s Nursing & Rehab and be a part of a rewarding healthcare environment dedicated to making a positive difference in the lives of children.

title: Clinical Specialist, Wound Care Supplies
description:
Asure Wound Solutions is seeking a highly skilled and dedicated wound care Clinical Specialist to join our team. This is a remote position based in the Brooklyn area and requires experience working in nursing homes or long-term care facilities as well as a strong background in wound care. The ideal candidate must be comfortable driving distances up to 2 hours away.



Starting salary for this position is $85,000/yr



Shift: Monday - Friday


**Wound Care Responsibilities:**


* Provide clinical expertise and support to nursing homes and long-term care facilities in the management of wounds and wound-related conditions
* Develop and implement wound care plans for residents in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team
* Educate and train nursing home staff on proper wound care techniques, products and equipment usage
* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to ensure proper wound care is provided in a timely manner
* Monitor and document the progress of wounds and adjust wound care plans as needed
* Maintain current knowledge of best practices in wound care and stay abreast of new developments in the field


**Wound Care Requirements**:


* Active nursing license
* At least 3 years of nursing experience in nursing homes or long-term care facilities
* Wound care certification preferred
* Strong understanding of wound care principles and practices
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Strong computer skills and proficient in Microsoft Office
* Must be comfortable driving distances up to 2 hours away


Asure Wound Solutions offers a competitive salary and benefits package for our wound care Clinical Specialists. If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for wound care, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
company_description: aSure Wound Solutions innovates wound care for better healthcare outcomes. We offer advanced products and services to improve patient care and streamline processes for long-term care facilities.

title: RDT (Registered Developmental Technician)
description:
**About Kinder Growth**  



At Kinder Growth we strive to support children with autism in building strong, meaningful, and enjoyable relationships with those around them. We work to support children in unlocking their potential to bring forth a happier and more engaged child.  



We take great pride in the Kinder Growth work environment. Our emphasis on employee happiness, growth, collaboration and communication are our guiding values when it comes to our staff. We recognize the value of our staff and their potential to contribute to our Kinder Growth team.  



Start your journey with us today!  


**Here’s what we’re looking for…**  



We are seeking playful and energeticRDTs to play with autistic youths. We work in the home or at school providing one to one DIRFloortime therapy sessions.
**Benefits Offered…**


* Flexible and part time hours, including evenings and weekends, with the availability to build a full time caseload.
* Career Advancement: Extensive support for those interested in advancing in an evolving field.
* Supervision: Regular direct supervision and mentoring by DIRFloortime credentialed professionals.
* Training: Meet with other RDTs under the supervision of clinical leadership for a monthly team meeting and training on various topics related to DIRFloortime.
* RDT training reimbursement
* No more than a 30 minute commute, with client-to client mileage reimbursement.
* Full time employees: Health Insurance.

  


**Here’s what your role as a** **RDT** **may look like...**  


* Work under the supervision of an AFT (Advanced Floortime Player) or QHP (Qualified Healthcare Provider).
* "Befriending" the youth.
* Playing 1:1 to support the child in development
* Video your session to reference back to when reflecting on sessions.
* Light data collection.
* Use positive, affective approaches to create meaningful change.

  


**Requirements:**
* Bachelors Degree and 1 year related experience or education (Education, Counseling, Psychology, Sociology, Developmental Intervention, RBT/ Behavior technician)
* Valid form of ID
* Pass Federal and State background checks
* Must have reliable transportation
* Ability to play on the floor
* Working device to take session data and video sessions

  


**COVID-19 Precautions:**
* Remote interview process
* Virtual meetings


**Job Types:**
* Full-time, Part-time


**Pay:**
* $25 per hour


**Education:**
* Bachelor's (required)


**Experience (1 year required):**
* Child care (babysitting, daycare, paraprofessional, preschool teacher, assistant teacher)
* Special education (educational settings, special needs)
* Developmental intervention (early intervention)
* Autism interventions (RBT/ Behavioral technician, Autism support specialist, ABA therapist, RDT, other DIRFloortime experience)


**Work Location:**
* Multiple Locations

title: External Marketer/Liaison
description:
Alaris Health located in NJ is looking for an External Marketer/Liaison for Hudson County.



The purpose of the External Marketer/Liaison is to assess and monitor an individual's status to determine appropriateness for continued medical services, as well as coordinate and evaluate continued services through communication and collaboration with individual patient, family members, and other healthcare professionals.



Duties and Responsibilities:



1) Evaluate referrals from hospital social workers, physicians, case managers, patient care coordinators, and families by telephone and in-person assessment.



2) Establish and maintain working relationship with referral sources.



3) Advocate for client to provide appropriate level of care.



4) Monitor ongoing medical status of patient for any changes in condition.



5) Maintain and demonstrate working knowledge of the physical, psychological, psychosocial, and financial aspects of the rehabilitative process.



6) Obtain accurate current and past medical history of patient.



7) Collaborate with Admission Staff, Internal case manager, and Director of Nursing to ensure ease of transition for client to facility.



8) Obtain insurance eligibility.



9) Determine leve of care to be administered to patient.



10) Promote effective commmunication between patient, family member(s), healthcare professionals, and payors.



11) Collaborate with patient, social worker, case manager, patient care coordinator, family, and physician in establishing treatment goals.



12) Establish contact with insurance case manager and negotiate cost effective rates



13) Must have at least one year experience in healthcare -subcute / skill nursing



BENEFITS:


* PTO
* Health and Dental insurance
* 401k
